channel.title: Black page
channel.description:
This is what the web could look like under the Stop Online Piracy Act.
Keep the web open. Contact your representatives or find out more
(click anywhere to continue)
Pretty damn annoying, what is this bullshit?

item.title: Black page
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:58, topic:429735”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=532414.msg3891891#msg3891891 date=1326936335]

At least we had color on these damn forums besides white and blue. And it was removed so stop complaining.

black is not a colour

Since when is black not a color? I meant a color besides white and blue, I would find black a color? Don’t go mind-fucking me here.
[/quote]
Black is no color and white is all color iirc.[/quote]
absence of colour*

Read full topic

item.title: Black page
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

rofl I just noticed the google logo, the black spot i thought was something wrong with my grafix performance but
i just realized it was supposed to mean SOPA

item.title: Black page
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:47, topic:429735”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=532414.msg3891819#msg3891819 date=1326932021]
kk we know its important however its still as annoying as fuck I would gladly vote for this thing if it stopped popping up afterwords. Also, @ Frell you should be setting an example not saying ‘shut the fuck up’ difference between mods and normal users. Normal users can show there bad sides, mod’s are moderators if you don’t know what a moderator typical does please feel free to google it.

inb4butusucksostfucausei’mtoobusykissingmodass.
[/quote]
Spaces are your friend, and being a mod doesn’t mean he can’t tell someone to shut the fuck up. His job is to enforce the rules, and lock/delete/move topics. Mods are, for the most part, janitors.[/quote]
‘Basic moderator duties include deleting or modifying inappropriate posts, educating newcomers about forum guidelines, and possibly deleting accounts of repeat offenders. Additionally, moderators may be experts in their field who can help minimize unanswered questions.’
source : http://www.marketingterms.com/dictionary/moderator/

I purposely left the spaces out, derp if you didn’t realise that. It goes without saying that moderators are expected not to talk to any one individual like that, I think if he was a trial mod(not sure if they exist on these forums) he would have been pulled up about that. No, mod’s for the post part if compared to a human job role then they would be Police Officers as they have the power to enforce the rules of the forums, they do basic tasks like lock topics etc to help the forum Police Officers do a lot of things to help people like take people how if there lost and so forth(if asked of course) and so on I really can’t be bothered explaining all the similarities but theres lots.
Moderators should be aloud to swear of course however, they should not be able to swear at someone or try and make the person’s post that it was talking about seem invalid as Frell did. For example, this in my opinion at least would be okay ‘I fell over the other day and I hurt my foot pretty badly, it hurt a fucker.’ unacceptable ‘Lol, thats a retarded post’, similarly to what Frell did apart from he said Stfu and something else which i’m not going to check.

Read full topic
